intro: Borreria platyphylla, commonly known as the flatleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. It typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Borreria platyphylla is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
